comments:
Version: 3.1.0
Build id: I20050104-1600

Eclipse abruptly exited while i was working.  The only interesting messages in
the logs refer to "no more handles" and an invalid thread access afterwards.  I
haven't been able to reproduce the error.  I had just synchronized changes and
was editing a java file at the tiem of the crash.

Do you have any non-standard plugins installed?

I do have one additional plugin installed.  Since i wrote it, there is a good
chance it is leaking somewhere, although it is not a UI plugin so it shouldn't
be leaking handles.

I will try running for a few days without the plugin and see if it still happens.

What about the NPEs caused by the dispaly being released?  Is that a side effect
of "No more handles"?

I don't see any NPEs in the stacks you posted but yes, it's possible.  When we
run out of handles things become terribly unstable.

It has just happened again, so it doens' tlook to be caused by a third party
plugin.  I will install sleak and see if anything shows up.

I think the NPE was in another crash i got (don't have to logs on me at the
moment), but it isn't really important.

After editing for a while and closing all the editors i had a few hundred images
still allocated, most of them the warning and error icons (and their disabled
counterparts).

They all look somewhat like this:

Nick, Stefan...did you guys commit anything to account for this?
It appears that this has been fixed by Nick since the integration build.
I believe this was fixed during 3.1 M5.
